text: A HEAVY CARGO FREIGHTER is moments from docking - and it' most beautiful scene ever as the sun's BRIGHT ORANGE RAYS through the center of the ship, across the smooth water.
Someone is watching the ship closely as these private eye one end of the vessel to the other. The BUSY CREW prepare eminent dock.

The binoculars lower to reveal HARRY PHAN (50s), Chinese, thousand dollar suit and million dollar smile. Harry stan his custom Mercedes limousine. Out of the limo's backseat steps EDDIE STONE (50s), gray, hard as a rock. He speed dials a number on his cell.
(into cell) Move it in.
A small security cubicle sits next to a sliding chain-lin aligned with barb wire. A heavy set GUARD pokes his head window as a PRIMO'S PIZZA DELIVERY VAN approaches.
Can I get your name, please?
I got an order for twelve large pepperonis. The guard checks his clipboard. The driver plays it cool.
I don't see you on the list.

Look, man. I don't know anything about who ordered what or none of that. I just deliver the pies. I was told to be here at exactly five forty five, on the dot. The guard checks a wall clock which reads 5:45PM and spot cargo ship approaching the docks. He gives the driver a h up, opens the gate. The van enters. INT. WAREHOUSE/HOLDING AREA вЂ” DUSK Several DOCK WORKERS and WAREHOUSE EMPLOYEES use forklift load and unload heavy crates and pallets into various cor Enter the PIZZA VAN. It parks in one of the busier areas. driver steps out as he's instantly approached by an un-am WAREHOUSE MANAGER.

The hell you think you're doing? This is a restricted area. The driver is really TERREL вЂњT-BONEвЂќ STIGGS (20s), th the creepiest red eyes you've ever seen. He pulls a forty -- presses it against the man's head.
To the back of the van. Make a sound and I blow your brains all over your shoes. Stiggs walks his hostage to the rear of the van.

Open it. The manager opens the rear two doors of the van. Several MEN dressed as dock workers jump from the vehicle and cha room. All branding HIGH TECH AUTOMATIC WEAPONS. The men split in pairs of two, covering every corner. The quick and concise - professional.

One by one -- DOCK WORKERS are pulled from forklifts at gunpoint. -- TWO ARMED GUNMEN pass a large window and see an OFFICE behind his desk. They riddle the window with GUNFIRE as t clerk dives for cover.
Stiggs slowly walks up on the rear door of the security c as he charges in, draws down on the guard.
Shut your eyes. The guard squeezes them shut, like a scared child. Stiggs strikes him over the head.
A large K-9 unit truck marked U.S. CUSTOMS SERVICE stops security window. Stiggs, now dressed as a security guard, his head through the open hole. The CUSTOMS AGENT greets him.
How're you doin' today?
Better than you. Stiggs points an MP5 ASSUALT WEAPON in the driver's windo unloads on the customs agent - blows pieces of him on the Stiggs cracks a toothy grin.

A long STICK CRANE removes a steel shipping container fro ship, slowly lowers it to the pier. Watching from the gro is Harry Phan, Eddie Stone, and several of Harry's men. Harry is ear to ear smiles as he slowly puffs away at a cigarette. Just as the ship container touches the docks, Eddie give heads up to four of the men. All armed and toting heavy backpacks. The men hump it up the gangway and into the vessel. INT. WAREHOUSE/HOLDING AREA вЂ” DUSK A flat nosed TOWING RIG hauls in the steel shipping conta taken from the ship. It parks with the rear end facing Ha and his gunmen.

Harry's men strategically place their backpacks on the oi scum ridden floor. Fuel gauges, switches and meters cover room from ground to ceiling. INT. WAREHOUSE/HOLDING AREA вЂ” DUSK Harry, Eddie and the others watch as one of the gunmen un the locking mechanism from the rear of the container -- s open the doors. Harry watches as two of his men use tire irons to pry ope wooden crate. Dozens of boxes marked in Chinese writing a stacked one on top of the other. Harry opens one of the boxes and pulls out a cylinder sha can of dry cereal. He pops off the lid and pours the cere over the other cases. Small plastic baggies of CRYSTAL ME drop from the can.
A large semi truck and trailer backs into the open dock.
A forklift finishes loading the last of the wooden crates the back of the trailer. Harry watches as his men hook and lock the back of the se trailer. They are fast, precise.
Eddie, standing by the limo, gives the go ahead.
(into walkie) It's time.
One of Harry's men responds to Eddie's call through a two walkie.
Roger. He throws up a hand signal to the other three men. In uni the other men reach into their bags and start a digital t 10:59, 10:58, 10:57... All four men quickly retreat.
Harry joins Eddie in the back of the limo as the Mercedes away, leaving the pizza delivery van on the dock.

The hostages are lined up like ducks in a row. All with t hands on their heads. Five gunmen draw down on them with automatic weapons, watching them like hawks. Stiggs unhooks an empty shipping container as the hostage forced inside, one at a time.
Let's go! Move it! Stiggs shoves the last of the hostages inside and quickly them up. Stiggs and the rest of Harry's team retreat.

Stiggs and his team load into the back of the pizza deliv as it speeds from the docks and out the front gate. The CARGO SHIP ERUPTS IN A GIANT BLAZE OF FIRE. The force of the explosion is so strong it shoots the fla hundred feet into the air.

A black Hummer twists its way up a steep and winding driv The surrounding foliage is green and full of life. A beau sight. Harry's posh mansion hides behind some shrubbery. The Hummer circles a giant water fountain. A culdesac lea them to the front of the home. Out steps -- Eddie Stone and two more men. From the front seat steps D RIVIERA (30s), Cuban-American, sharply dressed, trim bear From the back steps his partner HAL BENSON (40s), aged, w weary, dark, tired eyes, sloppy. And these men are two of LAPD's not-so-finest. Benson and Diego stare at the grounds in a state of awe. are both reluctant to follow Stone's lead.
Harry, Benson and Diego hover over the balcony rail, star at a hopping pool party with several twenty-somethings, y men and women, swimming, sunbathing, drinking.

They were street urchins when I found them. Lost, angry souls. No family, no job. Nothing to live for. Disposed of by society. You find someone like this. Feed them. Cloth them. Give them shelter. Provide them with means beyond their wildest imagination. Along with a steady supply of whatever poison they're polluting their bodies with...and they become loyal as lapdogs. Diego observes the crowd - unimpressed.
I don't know. They don't look so dangerous to me.  Harry smiles.
Come. I have something to show you. Harry leads the men back inside - as they pass a heated g pool between two hot bikinis, one of which is smoking met a glass pipe.
About a dozen of Harry's strays are firing pistols and au weapons at paper targets. Young men and women. Harry walks Diego and Benson down the line.

As you can see, it's not all fun and games. There's a small price to pay for sitting in the lap of luxury. I keep my soldiers sharp. All highly trained, highly skilled in whatever mission I see fit. Benson peeks through some venetian blinds at a whole couc of YOUNG WOMEN in thousand dollar gowns, lined up in a ro taking turns going down on one of Harry's goons. A specia of training. Harry leads the two men onto an outside deck with a full a stone fire pit, leather chairs, swank couches. He pours the men a shot of scotch.
I'm building an empire. Soldiers loyal to me. Ready to carry out my vision. To follow orders... without question. He hands Benson and Diego their drinks, as the partners s quick look.
Tell me where you can find that kind of loyalty in your police department.

That's where you gentlemen come in. As I said, I've been spoiling them far too much. The problem with kids...you spoil them...they get greedy. And they get sloppy. Go into business for themselves. And then they get caught. I can't have my name mentioned every time one of my people get busted slinging dime bags to school kids.
What do you want from us? Harry grabs two manila files from the bar's surface, hand to Diego and Benson.

I need certain people off the street. Mister Stone tells me you're the men for the job. Diego peeks into a rear window and watches as one of the of the evening drops her evening gown to the carpet and unbuttons her bra. Harry steps closer to Diego, grabs his attention.

I've compiled some lists for you men. The names on these lists have become a serious problem for me. I need you to dig up their records. Find any means necessary to make the charges stick. Diego opens his file and takes a look.
You want us to frame up every name on this list?
You don't understand, Detective. I'm not asking you to arrest them.  Diego checks with his partner, who is just as unsure.
A young thug in black tank-top, wild swim trunks and jail tats, wanders back and forth at a corner stop sign. This

Anthony uses an ipod to pass the time. Just a few feet fr him, parked at a curb, is his black PORSCHE BOXSTER. He greets another young SURFER TYPE and his GIRL with a q hand shake and a hug. A dope deal. Anthony plays an air drum solo just as Harry's limousine up from behind. Anthony spots it, books it up the sidewal Eddie Stone and Stiggs step from the backseat. They chase Anthony, who is caught by two more of Harry's soldiers. SOLDIER #1 forces him to the ground and pulls CAR KEYS fr pants pocket, throws them to Stone. Stone and SOLDIER #2 head for Anthony's PORSCHE while Sti SOLDIER #1 escort Anthony to the limo, toss him in the ba

Stiggs and Harry's Soldier on each side of Anthony, watch like a hawk. Anthony scared for his life as he spots the visible face of Harry Phan across from him. Harry leans in closer, holds a cigar in one hand, a scotc the other.
Hello, Anthony. How's business? Anthony stalls, sweats guilt like a stuck pig.
Great, Mister Phan. I've just been out here, generating some business for you. You know how it is.
So... on top of stealing from me, you're insulting my intelligence.  10
(begs) It's not like that. Harry, please. Stiggs flips open a switchblade, rubs it up and down Anth neck.

We had a deal, Anthony. I gave you everything. A roof, money, pleasures well beyond your means. All I've asked for in return is your loyalty. When I trust you with my business, I trust you with my life.
Please, Harry. You can trust me. I just lost my head for a minute. I'm sorry.
I'm afraid your word isn't good enough. If I'm to trust you with my life...I'll need reassurance. Stiggs cracks an evil grin. Anthony notices.
I hear you and Lisa are quite the item these days.
Hey, man. Don't hurt her. Please.

Your associate Mister Degrassi has refused a sit down. On top of this, you've been using my product to help your goomba friends bankroll their filth. You're involvement with this man has all but painted a target on my back for the police. (dead serious) I told you what would happen if you crossed me. Didn't I? Anthony's chest heaves, sweats like crazy, beyond scared.  11
You took what was most important to me. The way I see it, Anthony, there's only one way to make things right between us.
I'll do whatever you want me to do.

NICK DEGRASSI (30s), a real grease ball with slicked back and a silk shirt with palm trees, leans in his swivel cha feet kicked up on his desk, balances a pencil on his nose In walks his busty secretary TIFFANY (20s)
Excuse me, Nick. A Lisa Huber is here for you. Nick doesn't budge from his relaxed position.
Tell her I'm busy.
She says she's a friend of Tony's. That you're expecting her. Nick quickly sits up, the pencil spills to the floor.

She's one of Tony's girls, huh? Send her in. Nick squirts some breath spray as Tiffany steps out and s the door behind her. In walks LISA HUBER (20s), thin, malnutrition-ed, pale, b dolled up for her audition. She's the girl next door type a pair of legs that go all the way up. Nick sizes her up. He cracks a small grin.
So. Tony tells me you're very talented.  12 Lisa awkwardly crosses her arms, covering her exposed cle
So tell me something, Teresa. Just how talented are you?
Actually, it's Lisa. And I'm not real sure I know what you mean.

Yeah, I just bet you don't. But I'm hip. You like to play the clueless schoolgirl routine, twirling your little hair, acting all lost and helpless. Nick bounces in his chair, nodding, biting his bottom lip look of pure lust across his face.
I bet you do that to all the boys, don't you? Lisa looks increasingly uncomfortable as Nick's creepy st burns a hole in her chest.
Isn't there a script or something? Nick smiles as he pushes away from his desk, wheels his c into the open and unbuttons his fly.
Nah. Consider this more of an oral interview. Lisa's eyes twitch, lips quiver with hate. She clumsily p silenced TWENTY-TWO from her purse and FIRES THREE SHOTS Nick's chest.
Lisa quickly exits, anxious, sweating. The outside waitin is wall to wall with nubile young women, all dressed to k putting on makeup and doing their hair.  13

Lisa storms into the staircase with her purse dangling fr arm, breathing hard, running for her life. She almost run TWO HOTTIES coming up the steps. She pushes straight through them. They turn and stare, pi off, ready to scrap.
Check the fucking yield sign!
Lisa runs into the street, cell phone in hand, still brea hard, staring in both directions.

Tony, where the hell are you?! Lisa spots Tony's familiar PORSCHE BOXSTER creeping aroun corner as she smiles in relief. And all of a sudden... The Porsche SQUEALS ITS TIRES, barrels toward Lisa at a c speed as her smile turns to sheer panic. Pow! The force of the collision sends Lisa tumbling over the r the car, crashing onto the asphalt. The Porsche speeds off.

The Porsche Boxster rushes into the busy parking lot of t posh, high class eatery, stops near a young VALET. Out of the Porsche steps Eddie Stone and one of Harry's m back from their mission. Stone hands the CAR KEYS to the VALET, who quickly parks Porsche in an empty spot near the front.  14

Anthony hovers over Harry as he sits in a private, reserv near the kitchen, finishes his meal with a swig of Saki. Stiggs and some of Harry's crew have joined him for lunch they sip beers and watch a sniveling Anthony beg, grovel forgiveness.
So, that's it? We're square? Harry wipes his mouth with a linen napkin.
For now. Anthony checks with Stiggs, who is ear to ear smiles. He' bit unsure as he slowly backs toward the door.
Thank you. Like I said, I'll make it up to you. Whatever you need, I'm yours.
Of course. Because without trust, what do we have? Wouldn't you agree?
Of course. Anthony finally turns, hurries for the front door. Harry, Stiggs and the other men share a smile. They know little something Anthony doesn't.
Anthony waits by the door as the VALET pulls his Porsche front. The Valet jumps out as an anxious Anthony crawls in and s the door.  15
Anthony notices his glove box is open and a LOADED GUN re inside.
What the hell...? Anthony grabs the weapon, gives it a once over. Before he knows what's going on -- BENSON and DIEGO draw down on him with TWELVE GAUGE SHOTG
Police! Turn off the engine and step out of the car!
Oh, shit. Diego covers the passenger side as Benson moves for the d window.
Drop it! Anthony panics and fires through the passenger window.

The shots miss Diego by a mile as he and Benson unload ro after round from their SHOTGUNS. Benson and Diego empty their weapons into the Porsche, BL SHARDS OF GLASS ALL OVER THE PAVEMENT. They observe Anthony's body, and then each other. There's of shame and regret on their faces as a THICK SMOKE still in the air. And then -- The METALLIC HUM of a familiar SONG begins to build in th as the two cops observe their handy work.

вЂњTHE HEAT IS ONвЂќ bursts onto the screen along with a PONTIAC GTO CONVERTIBLE. Behind the wheel is none other than AXEL FOLEY (50s), bla suit with white stripes, matching hat and dark shades. Axel rests an arm on the side of his door as he cruises t down district of Highland Park. TITLE CARD: вЂњBEVERLY HILLS COPSвЂќ ROLL CREDITS as we observe --вЂ” -- A DRUNK on the street. -- KIDS on a basketball court. One body checks the other fight ensues. -- A HOOKER at the point, making a date. She pulls out a wedgie from her mini-skirt, pokes her head in a car windo

Axel's GTO pulls a quick u-turn, parks against a curb out this dingy, sketchy looking joint. Out steps Axel in his but flashy pimp get-up. As he struts his way to the door George Jefferson style, of hooligans swarm around his ride, one with a basketball his arm, fresh off the court. HOOLIGAN #1 uses a tape measure on his front left RIM.

In walks Axel, as the unimpressed, dressed down crowd tur stare at the clown suit by the door. вЂњOhio PlayersвЂќ b the juke. A thick SMOKE lingers in the air. Axel twirls a tooth pick in his mouth, observes the smoke room of thugs, low-lives and hookers. The girls, gathered bar, painted up, weaves and wigs, texting, chewing gum, b Other locals shoot stick, play cards, swill beers.  17 Axel feels their contempt as he makes his way through the and to a corner booth where he meets with -- RUDY VALENTINE (40s), wannabe thug, hooded jump suit, smo philly blunt, a chubby heart attack waiting to happen. Rudy nearly jumps from his seat as Axel approaches, clums anxious. He shakes his hand, throws him a hug.
Yo, Boogie Ray, what's up, brother? Lookin' good. Axel jerks away.
First of all...don't touch the suit! Second, never mind that shit! Third, where the girls at?!
Be cool, brother. They just runnin' a little late, that's all. Have a seat and relax.

I ain't got time to relax. I'll relax when I get home. Right now, I'm workin'. I'm doin' business, and from where I'm standin', you ain't ready for business, and you're wastin' my fuckin' time. So fuck you and good night. Axel turns to leave. Rudy chases him down.
I can get em here in five minutes. They just a phone call away.

Hey, man. I know bullshit when I smell it, okay? You said ten o'clock and the girls would be here. I see bitches at the bar, bitches playin' pool, and you in the corner like you sittin' in the no pussy section. Time is money and you costin' me money. I'm outta here.  18 Once again, Axel races for the door and Rudy grabs his ar
Look, I said they'll be here, okay, now settle down and have a seat. I got you a Hennessey and coke. Axel stares down at Rudy's hand on his arm. Rudy backs of

Don't have me standin' around...like an asshole! I got business to take care of! You don't want my business, I'll take my big ass bag of money elsewhere! The crowd all take notice, turn and stare at Axel and Rud Rudy grows nervous.
I won't man. Now sit down and shut up for a second. Alright? Axel heads to the booth. Rudy takes a seat across from hi
I can get her here in five minutes. Just cool out.

What's this her, bullshit? I said girls! As in two very specific girls! A redhead and a mulatto! The word on the street was you were the man to talk to! You better not be goin' back on our deal! Like you fuckin' with Johnny the banana man here!

Okay, it's like this. The redhead's down. She's a pro, been workin' the street for five years, ready for business. But her friend, she's new to the life. She's a little unsure, but said if the money's right, she's ready to talk. Axel gives him an unsure look. A slight grin.  19
Cut the bullshit. What do you want?
So it's like this, brother. Money talks and bullshit walks. You show me the green and I'll make the call. I can get em here in ten minutes.
Ten minutes? What happened to five?
Look, you wanna do business or not? Axel pulls a brown envelope from his suit pocket, hands i the table to Rudy, who fans it out, gives it a look.
Sit tight. I'll be back. Rudy jumps for the table, heads for the door as Axel make the men's room.
Axel locks himself in a stall, speed dials a number on hi as he nervously peeks through the cracks.
(into phone) Hey, it's me. Are you sitting down?
Axel's client KENAN MARCUS (50s), black, ex con, a striki large, but tired looking man slowly takes a seat on his c A very worried look shoots across his face.
I am now. What is it?
I found her. Kenan shuts his eyes in peaceful relief.  20
Don't mess with me, Axel. Not now. Kenan grips an old family photo of him, his blonde wife a gorgeous daughter LOLA MARCUS (14), big green eyes, perfe smile, mulatto.
Axel still in the bathroom stall as he peeks through the cracks of the door.
I'm not. My guy on the street says she's cribbing with a girlfriend at this guy Rudy Valentine's house. Rudy just confirmed it about two minutes ago. She's on her way.
She's meeting you there?
Now, look. I don't want you coming down here and scaring them off. You can see her soon enough, but I'm gonna need at least a couple hours.
She's in trouble, isn't she? Forget it. I'm comin' down there.

Look. Didn't I say you need to trust me on this? Trust me. You comin down here is a real bad idea. Sit tight and you guys will be together soon enough. Right now, I need a couple hours to get this deal done. Alright?
Kenan, still staring at the photo, wanders back and forth living room carpet, a tear in his eye.
Yeah, alright. But nothing...I mean nothing better happen to her, Foley.  21

Axel comes back from his trip to the men's room and spots MARCUS (21), all grown up, beautiful, and friend REENA O' (20s), redhead, big hair, covered in freckles and tatts. The two friends remove their coats and take a seat at the table where Rudy and Axel were sitting. Rudy is nowhere t found. Axel surveys the room. He checks the front door and spots quickly making his way out just as --

-- enter and pull two silenced UZIS from their trench coa aim straight for Axel. Axel runs, leaps behind the bar, just as the Masked Men u round after round in his direction. The bottles behind the bar EXPLODE as bullets rip them to and patrons dive for cover. MASKED MAN #1 hurries over to LOLA and REENA, cowering in seats, hands over their heads. The shooter removes his mask. It's none other than TERREL STIGGS. Lola stares up at him just as Stiggs drops and re a magazine.

Come on, man! Hurry up! Lola and Reena make a run for the door. Axel pops up from behind the bar and takes a few shots at as he tips over a table, uses it as cover. Masked Man #2 returns Axel's fire as he cowers behind the Stiggs spots Lola and Reena making for the door. He cocks weapon, riddles them both with bullets. The two girls fall to the floor. A bloody mess. Stiggs an partner retreat out the door. Axel's head pops up from be the bar, gets a closer look at Stiggs.  22 Axel leaps over the railing, runs to the two girls on the bleeding, dying. Lola's dead eyes stare back at him.

Axel leans against his GTO, holds a rag against his blood as he watches the CORONER load Lola into a meat wagon. UNIFORM COPS question several patrons looming around outs the lead investigator, DETECTIVE MORRIS (40s) curly hair, and pudgy, takes a statement from a HOOKER with orange ha a leopard dress. He obnoxiously snaps at his gum as he approaches Axel.
You know, Foley, I thought we were all done with you for good. Guess I should know better by now.
Yeah, I guess you should.
So who were those two girls? No, wait. Let me guess. New business associates of yours?
My head's fine. Thanks for asking.
Oh, yeah? Well I got some news for you, smartass. We got two workin' girls here. And whoever hit em went after you first. Judging by the way you're dressed, one might get the wrong idea.

The black girl's Lola Marcus. Her old man just finished a ten year stint at Jackson for armed robbery. After a few hundred phone calls and letters to his daughter go unanswered, he hired me to find her. Morris shakes his head with disgust.  23

This Lola finds out her old man is getting out of the joint and goes into hiding. Next thing you know someone tries to burn all three of you. Pretty wild coincidence don't you think? Axel gives him a dirty look and takes a stroll up the sid
I know what you're thinking and you're wrong.
Am I? He was an ex con, right?

I know this guy. There's no way he had anything to do with it. All he wanted for the last ten years was a chance to see his baby girl again. Axel watches with sincere sadness and regret as the coron van pulls away from the curb.
Now he gets to identify her at the morgue.
Okay, smart guy, so who was it then? Axel faces him.

Rudy Valentine. (beat) A couple weeks back, Lola hooks up with the redhead and the two of them move in with redhead's sister at her boyfriend's house. That's Rudy. I put the word out I was lookin' for a couple of girls and cut a deal with him.  Axel just 24
Is that it?
What do you mean...'is that it'? What else do you need? It's obvious whoever wanted Lola dead knew I was lookin' for her. They pay Rudy to turn the other cheek and set all three of us up.
That's great, but it doesn't answer the million dollar question. Why did they want you?
Who knows? I've been doin' some asking around about Lola. Maybe they fingered me as a cop.
Yeah? Well I got news for you, Foley. You're not a cop anymore. So do us all a favor and stay out of this one. smiles and walks off. Morris follows behind.
If you're thinking about goin' after Valentine, you can forget it.
Oh, yeah? Why's that?
Cos he's dead. Axel stops in his tracks, faces Morris.
What?
Cops just found him at a stoplight with his engine running and his throat slit. This Lola girl sounds like she was running with a real nice crowd, huh?  25
Look, this girl's father is a friend of mine. Whatever she was into, he needs to hear it from me first. Morris observes Axel's face. An unsure look.
Stay out of this case.
Look, he trusted me to find out what was goin on with his daughter and to bring her home. I don't know if you noticed, but she died on my watch. Morris stalls. He finally cracks.
Okay, Foley. Fine. It's not like we have much to go on. Morris opens up a file on Lola Marcus.

(reads) Lola Marcus, twenty-one. Last known address, 426 Lincoln Avenue, Detroit. It looks like the last six months are clean. September of last year, she's busted on a possession charge in L.A. It appears your girl spent some time out there. Between April and September, she racked up over four thousand bucks in parking and traffic citations. Like I said, after September she went off the grid. We got nothing on her. Morris shuts the file.
There. Now you know as much as we do. Axel nods and heads to his car.
Hey, Foley! Stay outta this one!  26

The surrounding palm trees stand tall and proud as they r in the cool, midday breeze. OFFICERS and CITY WORKERS fil and out of the building as a lone figure is seen racing u tall front steps. This is -- LT. WILLIAM вЂњBILLYвЂќ ROSEWOOD, I.A.D. (55), tuxedo, un collar and loose bow tie. He's toting a heavy stack of fi as he rushes inside.

A visibly annoyed Detective BENSON sits before a small In Affairs review board committee, headed by ROSEWOOD and fo by -- LT. WEINBERG (40s), a short, elfish man, with black wire- glasses too large for his thin face, and -- SGT. VAUGHN (40s), an intense looking woman in a black bu suit and jet black hair pulled in a tight bun.

According to your report, Detective, you first noticed the suspect reach for his weapon upon entering the parking lot of Lao Chen's restaurant. (beat) But your partner maintains that your suspect didn't make a move for his gun until after you approached the vehicle.

Yeah, well, that's what I meant. As we were pulling in, I saw what looked like him popping the glove box, and when my partner and I stepped out... that's when he went for his piece. Weinberg checks with Vaughn who nods with approval.
Thank you, Detective. That'll be all for now.  27 Weinberg offers an insincere smile as Rosewood looks read jump out of his seat with impatience.
That's not all.
You have something else for Detective Benson?
I was just curious about something, Benson.
Shoot. Lt. Vaughn is put off by Benson's flippant attitude.
Sorry. Poor choice of words.
Well, I was wondering whether it was you or Riveira who decided on that particular parking lot to detain your suspect.
What're you getting at?
It's a simple question.
Neither. We ran the tag and hit the lights. The suspect pulled into the lot and we followed.
That's interesting. I guess you didn't know that Anthony LaRussa worked at Lao Chen's as a full time waiter?
No, I guess I didn't. It's my first time hearing of it. Is there a point to any of this?  28 Weinberg looks increasingly annoyed by this line of quest He huffs under his breath.
If there aren't any more questions for the Detective, I think this would be a good place to end.
Just one more question. Weinberg and Vaughn roll their eyes.
Have you ever heard of Phan Enterprises? This catches Benson's attention. He stays strangely quiet avoids eye contact.
Okay. I think that's enough for today. Thanks for coming in, Detective. Benson just smiles at Rosewood as he slowly stands.
Yeah. No problem. Let's do it again sometime. Benson heads out. Rosewood shakes his head with contempt the officer as he watches him leave.
Rosewood and Weinberg walk side by side toward an elevato neither look very happy with one another.
That was great, Rosewood. Very subtle. Bill Rosewood, caped crusader of all things corrupt. Vice cops running a ring of homeless dealers and prostitutes? Weinberg chuckles.
I thought I heard it all before.  29
The eyes never lie.
What?
His eyes. You see how he reacted when I mentioned Phan's name?

Probably because he didn't know what the hell you were talking about. For weeks you been after this Harry Phan character, and for what? All you got is the word of one cracked up hooker lookin' to get over on a cop.

Lola was too scared to come forward about Stone, so she sends her friend Reena instead. It's all coming together now.
Okay. I'm lost.

Rosewood took a statement from a girl about a bad cop. That was Reena. My guess is she was either there that night with Lola or decided to come forward to keep her friend in the clear. Rosewood checks his watch.
It's after nine. We got less than three hours before Ricky meets with Benson.
That is, of course, if Ricky got the message. But it looks like Ricky's long gone.  96
We're talking ninety thousand dollars here. We should assume that Benson got in touch with him by now. If not at home, then on his cell.
In the meantime, we got three hours to come up with a game plan. Otherwise, Ricky's a dead man.
We're gonna need a car.
Mine's a two seater. Axel smiles. They all turn to Jenny.
No way.
So did he fly to that medical conference or drive? Jenny laughs.

A spotless, shined up Cadillac Escalade parks in a red zo the front door and out steps Axel, Rosewood and Taggert. Axel is wearing a dark hoodie, a black leather racing jac shades as he pretends to be incognito. Rosewood and Tagge as bodyguards as they stare down the crowd waiting in lin The crowd turn and whisper to one another, point at Axel wonder who he is. The three men skip to the front of the line as a buff DOO is choosing who enters the club.  97

Say, my man. Sorry I'm late. Traffic was a bitch. Excuse us. Axel snaps his fingers at Rosewood and Taggert and they f him toward the door like lapdogs. The Door Man lays his hand on Axel's chest, stops him.
Hold it right there, flash. The line is that way. Points his beefy finger down the street.

Line? Ain't no line, cousin. I'm the entertainment. Mister Phan requested I be here no later than eleven thirty. It's eleven thirty five. We're supposed to be set up, ready to turn this mufucka out by midnight. So do me a favor and get your big monkey ass out my way before I gotta call Mister Phan and handle this, see?
You know what I think? I think you and The Oakridge Boys here ain't on the list. I think you're full of shit. So how bout you beat it before this big monkey turns you all into banana pudding.
Alright. You wanna do it the hard way? Fine. Axel removes his shades, drops his hoodie, and quickly fl his identification.
Axel Foley. Fire Marshall. (to Taggert) Would you frisk this man, please?
What is this?  98 Taggert approaches. The Door Man shoves him back. Rosewood flashes his holstered gun.
Sir, I suggest you cooperate or there's gonna be trouble. The Door Man slowly raises his arms as Taggert does a pat and discovers a small automatic pistol.
What's this about?
I'll tell you what this is about! This property just happens to be in violation of section PL90X and 867-5309 of the fire safety code! The Door Man squints with confusion.

Don't even get me started about the inside of this place! But you got people lined up down the streets blocking not one, not two, but three fuckin exits and a fire escape! The Door Man plays like he's checking down the street. He following along as he shakes his head with frustration.

Now I was gonna be a gentleman and come inside and give Mister Phan the opportunity to fix this! Instead, you chose to insult me and assault one of my marshalls! On top of this, you're carrying an unlicensed firearm! (to Rosewood) Mister Rosewood! Cuff this man!
Now hold on a second. I don't want any trouble. I'm just the door man. The crowd in line start to get ugly as they shout obsceni all four of the men.  99
Yeah, well. I'm afraid you had your chance to cooperate, sir. (to Rosewood) Are you gonna cuff this man or do I have to do it? Rosewood continues toward him. The Door Man steps back.
Hey, look. You wanna talk with Mister Phan, then go on. Alright? I just do what I'm told.
Rosewood. Back off. Rosewood backs away from him.
Can I go now?
Yeah, you can go. Get the hell outta here. Don't let me see you again. The Door Man jets as the rowdy crowd erupts. Axel and the head inside before they're trampled by the incoming clubb

Axel, Taggert and Rosewood move through a busy crowd, wal a Chinese Dragon Dance already in progress. The dragon zi its way through an array of glass table tops where clubbe seated. At each table, a torch is lit. The dancers move to the beat of the DRUMS as they glide a the floor.
Harry Phan and Stone watch Axel, Taggert and Rosewood fro two-way office window.  100
And here they are. Right on time.
Yeah. I wouldn't start celebrating just yet. It's quarter to and still no sign of the kid. Harry turns to him. A growing smile.
Don't worry. He'll be here.

Axel, Taggert and Rosewood take a seat at one of the glas tops. Axel scans the floor for any signs of Ricky or Skyl he spots -- SKYLAR picking up a drink order at the bar. She turns and Axel. A smile.
Axel. Isn't that her?
I see her. You guys hang back. Axel pats Rosewood on the chest as he heads for the bar.
Axel hurries to catch up with Skylar, who carries her tra corner booth. He grabs her by the arm as she turns to him A smile.
Look who it is. I guess you changed your mind. Axel flashes the photo of her and Ricky together.
You wanna explain this? Skylar checks the photo. She doesn't follow.  101
He's a friend. So what?
So we need to find a place to talk. Like, right now. Axel grabs her by the arm and drags her into a corner.

Hey, you don't need to do that. You wanna talk, we'll talk. Skylar turns her attention to a long, mirrored wall in th corner of the room. She sets down her tray of drinks, gra Axel by the arm and walks him toward the wall. There's a small slit in the glass as Skylar uses an ID CA is chained to her skirt to open up the private room. The mirrored wall opens up as Skylar and Axel head inside
Skylar shoves Axel into a leather chair as she hops on hi and starts an erotic lap dance.
There. Now isn't that better?
We don't have much time. He'll be here any second.
Look man. There's cameras all over this place. If you don't want me to get in trouble, then act like you're enjoying this.
Tell me what happened at The Pit Stop.
I don't know what you're talking about. Axel grabs her, makes her stop.  102
Then that must've been some other girl Benson was talkin' about killing if Ricky don't show with that money by midnight. Skylar sits in shock.
Oh, do I have your attention now? Skylar huffs in frustration. She comes around.
Look, I let him crib at my place, but I'm not involved in any of this. I even told him and Ginny they were nuts for going through with it.
Ginny. Who's Ginny? An exit door in the far corner opens and in walks --
with a back pack full of money. Ninety grand. He and Axel eyes, both surprised to see each other. A sudden realization hits Axel like a sack of bricks.
Two GUNMEN lock and load their machine guns and take aim glass wall. One of them is Benson.
Axel shoves Skylar and himself to the floor.

(to Ricky) Get down! The glass wall is RIDDLED WITH AUTOMATIC GUNFIRE as Ricky with several shots. He falls to the ground. Dead.  103 The bag of money also falls limp to the floor. As the glass wall explodes and breaks into large shards o carpet, Axel raises his gun and FIRES MULTIPLE SHOTS. One of the men is struck in the shoulder and chest and fa the floor. Benson escapes down the hall. Axel checks on Skylar.
You okay?
No, are you crazy? Axel checks on Ricky. Now dead. In runs Taggert and Rosewood, guns drawn.
Axel!
What the hell happened?
Never mind that! Take the girl and get her outta here! Fast! Axel chases down the hall after Benson.
Axel fights his way through a busy crowd as they gather n back room bar and congregate on a tall staircase overlook dance floor. Axel spots Benson at the top of the steps, making his way the roof.
Axel pushes and shoves his way up the steps.

Benson pushes a circle of friends having some wine out of way - runs to a steel railing at the edge of the roof. A full view of the street. He's run out of places to hide Axel makes his way onto the roof as Benson spots him. Ben raises his gun in the air and FIRES A FEW SHOTS. The panicked crowd almost runs over Axel as they head for stairs. They knock his gun to the ground. One of the clubbers plays hero and attempts to grab Benso from his raised arm. During the scuffle, Benson drops his gun and punches the the mouth. Axel jumps him as the two almost fall over the railing. B grabs Axel's throat, chokes him as Axel digs his thumb in throat. Benson releases him as the two men gasp for air. Axel thr hard right hook and knocks Benson --
and
Benson falls through the glass and onto a lighted DANCE F where clubbers SCREAM and run for cover.
Axel's face appears over the railing as he stares down at dead cop on the dance floor. His BLOOD spills out in gush
Axel is out of gas, drops to his knees.  105
Skylar sits on a couch, shaking. Her nerves are shot. Axe the others hover over her, pump her for questions. Jenny enters with a cup of coffee. She hands it to Skylar takes a seat.
Thank you.
You're awful lucky you didn't get all of us killed back there.
They were gonna kill me! What would you do?
They were gonna kill you anyways. You set us up.
You said Ricky and Ginny took that money. Who's Ginny? Axel grabs a photo of the dead girl in the alley from Ros Shoves it in Skylar's face.
Is this Ginny? Skylar is quiet at first, but comes around.
Ginny worked at The Dragon Room as a waitress.
A waitress? You mean an escort.
Congratulations, cop.
I'm not a cop.  106 This is news to Taggert and Rosewood as they share a conf look. Axel showes Skylar a photo of Lola Marcus. Skylar is
I was hired to find this girl by her father.
You know her, don't you?
Yes. She also worked at the club as a dancer. Her name's Lola. I don't know what happened to her. I haven't seen her in weeks.
Tell me what happened to Ginny. She didn't die of natural causes. Phan had her killed and I wanna know why. Did they find out her and Ricky stole that money?
A few weeks back, Ricky tells me this cop Eddie Stone was working for Phan. He said this other cop found out he was on Phan's payroll and opened an investigation on him.
What was his name? This cop?
I don't know. All I know is Stone supposedly sent Ginny to get her hooks into this cop. Get him all hot and bothered and bring him back to The Pit Stop for a quick roll.
Why? shocked by his stupidity.
Whatta you mean why? They wanted to catch him on tape. Use it as blackmail.  107
So they killed her to cover their tracks?

No. Ginny got greedy. Her and Ricky came up with this plan. They burned a copy of the blackmail video of her and this cop, then played both sides. Taking money from Stone and the other cop at the same time.
Weinberg. Taggert and Axel turn to him.
Who?

Weinberg. He's IA. No wonder he's been putting up so much resistance. He's been working under the table for Stone this whole time. Rosewood paces the floor. Flustered. He's been played for fool by Weinberg.
(to Skylar) How was Lola involved in all this?

They sent Lola to spike Ginny's drink. She didn't know they were gonna kill her. She was supposed to just walk her to her car and drive her home. When she collapsed in the alley, Lola freaked out and called the cops.
So that's why she split town. She was afraid the cops would find out she killed her.  108
What's gonna happen to me now?
Nothing. You're gonna stay here for a couple days until we can figure this thing out. This is news to Jenny.
She is?

STIGGS is busy kickboxing a punching bag in Phan's high t and the room is dark. A simple light illuminates this cor the room. A dark presence enters the gym and waits by the door. Sti stopped by the sound of a door creaking open, turns.
We have a problem. The almost black silhouette of Harry Phan steps closer in light as his face is fully revealed.
Officer Benson is dead and our police friends have the girl. Stiggs ignores Harry, hits and kicks the bag as he moves tight circle.

It seems our involvement with Detective Stone has become more trouble than it's worth. I'm counting on you to take care of it. Stiggs finally stops, faces Harry, who offers nothing mor smile as he exits the room.

Stone stares down at the back pack filled with ninety tho dollars in cash sitting on a pricey glass dining table. He is locked in on this money - focused. Stone rubs the s on his face in a nervous fit, paces the floor. Several pi luggage are packed and ready as they rest on the tile. Stone is shocked to see --
standing in a door frame, his gun aimed and ready to shoo
Going somewhere, Stone?
What the hell're you doing in my house?
If you think I'm going down alone, you're crazier than I thought.
You have one other option. You can kill the girl, along with Rosewood and Foley.
So, paint an even bigger target on my back while you're sitting on a beach with ninety grand? I don't think so.
So you came here to take the money?
No. I came here to kill you and take the money.
Not very smart. Killing a cop. You're in enough trouble as it is. The way I see it...you need me.  110
I need you? How?
To get Rosewood and Foley out of the picture. For good. Tonight. Stone cautiously steps closer to Weinberg, who gets nervo backs out of the dining room, into the living room.
Your only other option is to run. And you won't get far. Not as long as they're alive. You know this.
Stay back. Stone forces him further into the living room.
We're running out of time. If we're gonna do this, I need you to focus. No more games.
Weinberg pulls back the hammer on his pistol.
I said get back.

Don't be stupid. Without me, you're dead. Drop the gun. And from behind a wall jumps STIGGS with a hypodermic nee he jams it in Stone's neck. Stone collapses to the tile f as Weinberg lowers his weapon.
There. You got him. Now give me the money. Stiggs cracks an evil smile as he nods toward the dining gives Weinberg the signal to grab the cash.  111 Weinberg hurries back into --
and snags the bag of money from the glass table. He check see if Stiggs is watching him and bolts for the front doo
Weinberg rushes to his car, jumps in with the bag of mone INT. WEINBERG'S CAR вЂ”- MORNING Weinberg sticks in his key. Not a click. Nothing. The car completely dead.
Start, you sonofabitch! Weinberg spots Stiggs standing in front of his car. A MAC GUN aimed, locked and ready.

head_text.subj: THE WINDSHIELD IS RIDDLED WITH AUTOMATIC GUNFIRE

text: - as Weinberg is quickly killed. Stiggs cracks a toothy grin as he heads for the passenger door, grabs the money from the empty seat.

Stone's unconscious body sits limp in an expensive reclin Stiggs places a FORTY FIVE in his lifeless hand. Stiggs is now wearing goggles and covered in a black tras material from head to toe. He holds the forty five to Sto temple, pulls the trigger. Pow! A bright CRIMSON RED sprays across a white leather couch marble coffee table.  112

Harry Phan's Mercedes limo sits in an empty field overloo very scenic downtown Los Angeles. Harry leans on the hood, smokes a cigarette as Stiggs arr his car and parks some few feet away. Stiggs steps out with the bag full of ninety thousand in he slowly approaches.
May I presume that Mister Stone is no longer? Stiggs nods.

Good. But Foley and Rosewood have become a bigger problem than I had first anticipated. One of Harry's soldiers steps out of the limo with anothe of cash. Harry takes it, unzips and flashes it to Stiggs.
One hundred thousand. Harry zips it up, tosses it in the dirt in front of Stigg

If Foley and Rosewood aren't dead by day's end...I'll have no choice but to assume you split with my money. And then I will kill you. Is this understood? Stiggs smiles, heads back to his car, throws the bag insi he steps in. Harry smiles as Stiggs drives off.
Stiggs exits a dirt road and enters the thin, two lane bl He picks up speed as he ventures off on his mission.

Stiggs uses a free hand to unzip the bag of money, peeks and spots a stack of cash. He hears a slight TICKING unde pile of money. He pushes away what turns out to be a short stack of bill discovers a BOMB just three seconds from detonation.

As Stiggs car careens out of control -- BOOM! It explodes into a hundred pieces of flame and rubb BLAZING TIRE bounces over a bluff and down a hill. Phan's LIMO passes and a rear window lowers. And Harry sn quick look at his handy work.

The room sits half in the hotel, half on a sand dune over the beach, no walls or windows, just an open deck with Gr like pillars holding it all up. Every table in the room is filled with eager faces, all d to the nines, sipping momosas or having coffee. Harry Phan sits at a stretched table under a giant banner reads UTOPIA HOTEL AND SPA GRAND OPENING. Nick Thomopolis sits at a table up front, flashy suit and The gorgeous HOSTESS takes to the podium to welcome every coming. A tall, Chinese-American goddess in a thousand do gown with fake, oversized breasts.
Welcome. And thank you for coming to the grand opening of the Utopia Hotel And Spa.  114 The crowd erupts with applause and cheers.

As a token of our appreciation for your support, you will find at your tables a one week complimentary pass for you and a guest. All expenses paid. The crowd all reach for a stack of cards at the center of respective tables as the room fills with excited chatter.

Of course...none of this would be possible if it weren't for one man. A man with a true vision. Please put your hands together for my husband...Mister Harry Phan. The room fills with deafening applause as Harry takes to podium, kisses his wife. Before he can utter his first word -- AXEL struts his way to the front, microphone in hand.

That's right! The man of the hour! Mister Harry Phan! Give it up! I said give it up for Harry! Axel claps his palms together, causing some REVERB on the mic in his hand. The crowd all cover their ears.

I gotta tell you, nobody's as excited to be here as I am. To be here...side by side with my friend Harry Phan. To celebrate this special day. I can tell he's just as excited to see me here. Harry shoots him the look of death.
Look at the look on his face. Priceless.  115

As many of you already know...Harry has sacrificed a lot to be here. And faced just as many challenges along the way. Thomopolis shifts in his seat, covers up his face from vi Axel pats him on the shoulder.

Nick Thomopolis, ladies and gentlemen. From guns and drugs to hotels. Good to see you, Nick. Thomopolis gives a quick wave hello to the crowd as he bu his face in his hands. Axel paces the floor under the podium as Harry gives him thousand yard stare.

But one thing you need to know about Harry...is when he sets his mind to doing something, he don't let anything or anyone get in his way. Not the FBI, the IRS, not even a federal indictment can stop Harry from opening his hotel. The crowd all turn and stare, whisper to one another.

And it's not just him that deserves the credit. As I look out here into this crowd...I see the many faces that have also sacrificed themselves and their time to fulfill Harry's dream. There are several tables up front filled with Harry's you and ladies. His вЂњsoldiersвЂќ.

Most people would say fuck it. I can do this on my own, but not Harry. He says I don't care how we raise the money. Stand on the corner, sling drugs, prostitute yourself, it don't matter. (beat) All that matters is the vision.  116 A couple of Harry's Soldiers, dressed in white tuxedos, b the front of the room, eyes on Axel.

And I see many faces here today, that have not only given themselves, but have sold their own bodies for this man, Mister Harry Phan. As the two soldiers draw closer, Harry warns them off wit and a simple wave of the hand. The two soldiers reluctantly back off but hold their grou stare back at Axel with a look that could kill.
You might know them. They may be sitting next to you right now. They may be your neighbors. They may even be your sons or daughters. You never know. Thomopolis quietly sneaks for the exit.

Nick Thomopolis! He says congrats on the hotel, Harry, but kiss my ass and have a nice day. I'm out. Thomopolis jets for the beach, never looking back. Axel g him a nice round of applause as he pats his two palms tog and causes another wicked REVERB. The crowd all cover their ears.

Now I don't wanna steal the show. After all, this is Harry's special day. To tell you the truth, he don't have that much longer to truly appreciate the fruits of his labor with his upcoming trial, so I'm gonna leave and let him enjoy this little bit of time he has left in peace. So thank you, Harry. Enjoy your brunch. It's Miller time. Thank you. Axel drops the mic on the floor as the REVERB sends the r an uproar. He heads for the exit.  117
Harry's limo casually cruises the palm tree dotted strip to the mansion.

Harry sits in the back with a sour scowl on his face, sip scotch rocks as he reflects on his ruined grand opening. He peeks through the front windshield as the limo creeps steep hill and is surprised to see a POLICE ROADBLOCK sit dead center of the posh street.
Mother-fucker. (to driver) Get us out of here!

Along with a couple dozen SQUAD CARS, marked and unmarked several UNIFORMED COPS, DETECTIVES, and Axel and Rosewood Rosewood smiles as he spots the limo creeping to a stop. also smiles as he struts down the street toward them. The limo cuts down a side street at high speed, SCREECHIN TIRES on the asphalt.
Harry's limo tries its best to evade authorities but SCRE to a halt as FOUR SQUAD CARS block the street from both s
Harry pulls his gun as he spots several UNIFORM COPS jump of their cars. He turns around, spots several more cars p up from behind.

Harry's limo is quickly surrounded with ARMED OFFICERS as draw down on the rear windshield and back passenger windo One officer forces out the DRIVER at gunpoint. Rosewood's Lexus arrives on the scene as Axel and Rosewoo out with beaming smiles.
I'll be back.
Axel. It's done. Let them handle it. Axel walks to the limousine and signals the officers to b as he jumps in the back seat.
Okay. Never mind. Fuck me. Rosewood shakes his head, gives up.
Axel sits across from a very upset Harry. The two are sil first as Axel sports a big, wide grin.
So. Here we are. I never really had a chance to introduce myself. My name is Axel Foley. Axel pulls the photo of Lola from his coat pocket. Hands Harry.
And that is Lola. She's the reason I got into this mess. Harry looks at the photo.
Pretty girl.  119
She was. She got killed.
That's too bad.
Yeah, I can tell you're real broken up about it.

Lola was special. Fresh. Not yet bruised by the ugliness of the world and so full of life and promise. I had high hopes for her. But, like so many others, she chose to throw it away. And for what? Peace of mind? Harry scoffs.
Your police department pretends to care, yet thousands of young women just like her are still on the street and they do nothing. Harry leans in closer to Axel.

How long do you think the Lola's of this world can last on their own? I gave her a home. I made a place for her. And for many like her. And your friends in the police chose to get her killed. Harry laughs.

For what? So they can get the bad guy. No matter who dies in the process. (beat) You think I'm the problem? My friend, you're the problem. Axel plays interested as he slumps forward in his seat an his face in his hands in a mocking fashion.  120

You're the problem because you and all like you refuse to face your own greed. You see it as a cancer. Something dark and unholy. Lola knew who she was and what she wanted, and she went after it. And now she's dead for what? (laughs) Because she chose to do the right thing? Now don't you think if she had the chance to do it over again, she'd do things a bit differently? (serious) The hypocrisy of the police department is almost absurd. Axel takes a moment to soak it all up.
You know, I was a cop for twenty five years and I've come up against some real nasty bastards, but you... (beat) You're something special. Harry smiles and nods.

Anyways, I just wanted you to get a good look at my face. You know, so you can think of it every night when you're cryin' yourself to sleep in your prison cell and masturbating with your own tears and shit like that. Harry is seconds from pulling his gun on Axel as he grips pistol tighter and tighter.

Do me a favor though. Just when you're gettin' ready to finish, think 'Axel Foley'. Every day you're gonna be saying to yourself 'I'm in here playin' with my own shit and never gonna get pussy again cos of Axel Foley'. That's what I want you to do.  121
Anyways, I don't know if you noticed or not, but there's some cops outside waiting, so I'll let them to it. Take care of yourself. Axel steps out, but stops half way.
Oh, yeah. One more thing. Harry waits for it.
Fuck you. Axel spits dead in his face. A smug smile on Harry's face slowly wipes it away.
That's for Lola. Axel goes on his way, leaves Harry to himself as the offi quickly place him in custody.

The BRIGHT ORANGE SUNSET that started our story is back a slowly falling over the ocean's still horizon. Axel works the grill as he cooks up some dogs and burgers Jan sits in Rosewood's lap, feeds him fresh strawberries. They giggle like schoolkids while -- Jenny watches them, jelly faced, from a deck chair, a dri hand. She rolls her eyes. Johnny and Jordan soak their feet in the hot tub while Ta and retired Police Chief ANDREW BOGOMIL appear from insid a bottle of champagne. Taggert blows the cork. POP!
Okay. I never got the chance to properly toast my son and his beautiful bride.  122 Johnny and Jordan smile, share a tight hug.
Johnny. That means you. Get your ass over here. They all share a laugh. Johnny and Jordan join the others Bogomil helps pour and hand everyone a glass of champagne
Don't spill. This is the good stuff. I hear we have Axel to thank.
(curious) Hey. Where did you get that? Did you find that in the wine cellar?
It doesn't matter where we found it. The man's tryin' to give a toast. Let him have his moment.
(to Johnny and Jordan) Here's to your never ending happiness and to new beginnings. Rosewood and Jan share a smile as she wipes some strawber his cheek.
(to Rosewood) To seeing old friends. And remembering what's really important. Rosewood tips his glass to Taggert, and then Axel. He als his glass to Jenny who cracks a grin.
I know none of us are promised forever. So I just wanted to be sure to say, just in case I never get the chance, that I love you. All of you.
Here here.  123 They all chug their glass in unison. Rosewood stands, joi hands with Jan as they join the group.
I guess this would be as good a time as ever to share our news. Axel and the others brace themselves.
You're pregnant?
Axel, please. (to Jan) You're not, are you? Jan smacks Axel on the chest as Rosewood laughs.
No. I think I'll stick with three, Dad, thank you.
So anyways. Where was I?
Oh, sorry. You were about to tell your Dad you guys were getting married. My fault.
Axel! Shit! Bogomil is overjoyed as he gives Rosewood a giant hug, an his daughter.
That's wonderful. Jenny joins them, gives Rosewood a quick hug and a kiss o cheek. She gives him an вЂњit's okayвЂќ look before huggi

Congratulations. You have yourself a good man. Take care of him.  124 Jan wipes her tears as her and Rosewood embrace. Jordan is jelly faced as she shoots the remainder of her champagne. Johnny notices she's upset.
What's your problem?
Nothing. It's just that this was our moment. They're stealing our thunder.
You're being silly. Stop it.
I'm not being silly. Axel sets his glass down and pulls Rosewood and Johnny aw the crowd, throws an arm around each of them.

Man, this is just too much. All of us together. Two of my favorite guys getting married. Tell you what. Today is your lucky day, cos yours truly is throwing his hat into the ring and unselfishly volunteering himself to throw the bomb bacherlor party to end all bachelor parties.
(whispers) Axel. Not now. Jenny smiles, crosses her arms.
Axel...?

No, no, no. I know what you guys are thinking. It's not gonna be like that. We're talking a very boring, very straight-laced bachelor party with just the guys. Nothing but us guys.  125 Jan points her boney finger at Axel.
No funny business. Johnny winks at Axel. Jordan shoots Johnny a nasty stare.
Are you kidding? Nah. I'm just talkin' about a small get together with just the guys, that's all. Taggert and Bogomil share a smile.
Why do I get the feeling there's more to this story.

It just so happens that on the way over here I found the perfect place for you guys. It's nice and quiet. Absolutely no women around. No alcohol. Very dull and conservative. You're gonna love it. Taggert, Bogomil, Jenny, Jan and Jordan all give him an u look. He's full of it.
Trust me. Axel turns and stares INTO THE CAMERA as WE FREEZE FRAME face and trademark smile. FADE OUT.
Axel Foley EDDIE MURPHY Billy Rosewood JUDGE REINHOLD John Taggert JOHN ASHTON Eddie Stone PETER WELLER Harry Phan CARY-HIROYUKI
